name: Kenta Nakai
content: Home Page of Kenta Nakai Kenta Nakai, Ph.D Professor of The Univ. Tokyo Affiliation Laboratory of Functional Analysis in silico Human Genome Center The Institute of Medical Science The University of Tokyo 4-6-1 Shirokane-dai, Minato-ku, Tokyo 108-8639, Japan Tel: +81-3-5449-5131 Fax: +81-3-5449-5133 e-mail: knakai @ ims.u-tokyo.ac.jp Also a professor of Dep. Computer Science, Graduate School of Information Science and Technology, the University of Tokyo Also a professor of Dep. Computational Biology and Medical Sciences, Graduate School of Frontier Sciences, the University of Tokyo Research Interests (Group Members) Sequence Analysis in Molecular Biology Bioinformatics in Genome Analysis Some of our Databases/Softwares: PSORT: prediction of protein localization sites in cells DBTBS: a database of Bacillus subtilis promoters and transcription factors DBTGR: a database of tunicate gene regulation DBTSS: a database of human transcriptional start sites (collaboration with Dr. Sugano's lab) DBTMEE: a database of transcriptome in mouse early embryos Melina II: an improved tool for motif extraction from unaligned set of nucleotide sequences OpenTein: an image database of stem cell-derived teratomas OpenContami: a web-based application for detecting microbial contaminants in next-generation sequencing data ItemLast updated List of Publications (English)29 November, 2025 List of Publications (Japanese)4 July, 2010 Other Miscellaneous Publications (Japanese)2 May, 2011 Curriculum Vitae (Japanese)22 May, 2006 Slides (Japanese)18 June, 2008 Prospectus pages for Dept. Frontier Sci. (English / Japanese)4 August, 2008 h-index: 48 (Web of Science ResearcherID: B-7293-2009; 60 (google scholar) 11 April, 2024 ORCID ID: https://orcid.org/0000-0002-8721-888319 November 2016 Link to Scientist Library at BRH (Japanese) very old Personal Fact Sheet30 August, 2010 Last update: November 29, 2025 knakai @ ims.u-tokyo.ac.jp
